turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hi, how are you doing?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Hi there.  I'm doing okay!  I just made a cup of tea and my dog's taking a nap on my bed right now, so things are nice and peaceful.  How about yourself?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That sounds so nice. I'm good too. Thanks for asking. You sound like a person who likes to help others.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I sometimes am but I don't know - no one's truly of pure virtue.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Well I wanted to know if you know about an organization called "Save the Children." They are a charity that helps kids in need around the world.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I'd be happy to hear more.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Do you know that any donation to them goes to buy kids food, clothing, school supplies etc.. basic necessities that probably we don't even have to worry about.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I do, but I also know that Carolyn Myles, the CEO, takes a nearly half million dollar annual salary.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Oh wow, where did you hear that?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: You can find more information about that on their Charity Navigator page.  They also have a troubling liability to asset number that makes me worry about their overall financial viability as a charity.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That's a bummer to hear about because I'm supposed to persuade you to donate some of your payment from this task to that charity.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yeah, they pick odd charities on here.  Save the Children isn't awful, really, it's just a charity I run into a lot.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Oh haha. I haven't done this before. Anyway. I'm supposed to ask you: How much do you like to donate to the charity now? Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment ($2).

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: 0 dollars, but I'll give the 2 to The Global Orphan Project on my own time because I think that's in spirit of this HIT

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That's awesome! I don't really trust gigantic charities either. Do you know what we do now?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: No, there's a message number we have to hit I think.  But I can tell you how fostering affected me and my family.  My half sister was born to a mentally ill mother and our shared father is abusive, so she was in foster care for a number of years.  Charities like this are really important to me because they helped her get in touch with me when she was older.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That's so great. It's good to just give to what we are personally invested in!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: It is, and I think when there's talk of defunding or ending programs like these, it's important for the people who's lives they've so affected to speak up.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Totally. Do you think this hit will really donate that money to Save the Children? It seems like a weird place to get donations.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: There's a lot of HITs that work like this and I've received documentation from the majority of them about those donations.  A great many are run through universities and the ethics boards there wouldn't allow them to deceive about charitable intent.
